description.text: Contains the nameplate information attached to the product
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABN590#001 URI of product instance
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA565#007 manufacturer Note: mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA567#007 name of product Note: Short designation of the product is meant. Note: mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.

value.text: A small figure put together from Lego and/ or Lego-like clamp building blocks, not glued, as per parts list and instructions attached.

description.text: The SMC “ContactInformation” contains information on how to contact the manufacturer or an authorised service provider, e.g. when a maintenance service is required. Note: physical address is a mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC

enumeration: 0173-1#07-AAS927#001 (administrativ contact), 0173-1#07-AAS928#001 (commercial contact), 0173-1#07-AAS929#001 (other contact), 0173-1#07-AAS930#001 (hazardous goods contact), 0173-1#07-AAS931#001 (technical contact). Note: the above mentioned ECLASS enumeration should be declared as “open” for further addition. ECLASS enumeration IRDI is preferable. If no IRDI available, custom input as String may also be accepted.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61360_4#ADA005#001 country code. country codes defined accord. to DIN EN ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes. Mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: language codes defined accord. to ISO 639-1. Note: as per ECLASS definition, Expression and representation of thoughts, information, feelings, ideas through characters.
Note: notation accord. to ISO 8601 Note: for time in UTC the zone designator “Z” is to be used
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA129#001 city/town. Mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.

Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA286#001 street. Mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA281#001 ZIP/Postal code. Mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: conditionally mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. One of the two properties must be provided: ManufacturerProductFamily (0173-1#02-AAU731#001) or ManufacturerProductType (0173-1#02-AAO057#002).

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA300#006 code of product Note: conditionally mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC. One of the two properties must be provided: ManufacturerProductFamily (0173-1#02-AAU731#001) or ManufacturerProductType (0173-1#02-AAO057#002).

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA950#006 order code of product Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.

Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA581#006 article number Note: Recommendation: property declaration as MLP is required by its semantic definition. As the property value is language independent, users are recommended to provide maximal 1 string in any language of the user’s choice.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABA951#007 serial number
Note: mandatory property according to EU Machine Directive 2006/42/EC.
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61987#ABB757#007 date of manufacture Note: format by lexical representation: CCYY-MM-DD
Note: see also [IRDI] 0112/2///61360_4#ADA034#001 country of origin Note: Country codes defined accord. to DIN EN ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes
Note: Every property can be used.
Note: The idShort is arbitrary
Note: The use of a displayName is recommended.
The Submodel provides the means to access the Carbon Footprint …
Balance of greenhouse gas emissions along the entire life cycle of a product in a defined application and in relation to a defined unit of use
Standard, method for determining the greenhouse gas emissions of a product
Norm, Standard, Verfahren zur Ermittlung der Treibhausgas-Emissionen eines Produkts
Sum of all greenhouse gas emissions of a product according to the quantification requirements of the standard
Quantity unit of the product to which the PCF information on the CO2 footprint refers
Quantity of the product to which the PCF information on the CO2 footprint refers
Life cycle stages of the product according to the quantification requirements of the standard to which the PCF carbon footprint statement refers

value.value: A1 - raw material supply (and upstream production)

description.text: Life cycle stages of the product according to the quantification requirements of the standard to which the PCF carbon footprint statement refers
Explanation which is needed or given so that a footprint communication can be properly understood by a purchaser, potential purchaser or user of the product
Indicates the place of hand-over of the goods
Street indication of the place of transfer of goods
Number for identification or differentiation of individual houses of a street
Zip code of the goods transfer address
Indication of the city or town of the transfer of goods
Country where the product is transmitted
Time at which something was first published or made available

The Submodel defines a set meta data for the handover of documentation from the manufacturer to the operator for industrial equipment.
Each SMC describes a Document (see IEC 82045-1 and IEC 8245-2), which is associated to the particular Asset Administration Shell.
Set of document identifiers for the Document. One ID in this collection should be used as a preferred ID
Identification of the domain in which the given DocumentId is unique. The domain ID can e.g., be the name or acronym of the providing organisation.
Identification number of the Document within a given domain, e.g. the providing organisation.
Set of information for describing the classification of the Document according to ClassificationSystems. Constraint: at least one classification according to VDI 2770 shall be provided.
Unique ID of the document class within a classficationsystem. Constraint: If ClassificationSystem is set to “VDI2770:2018”, the given IDs of VDI2770:2018 shall be used

List of language-dependent names of the selected ClassID. Constraint: If ClassificationSystem is set to “VDI2770:2018” then the given names of VDI2770:2018 need be used. Constraint: languages shall match at least the language specifications of the included DocumentVersions (below).
Identification of the classification system. For classifications according VDI 2270 always set to "VDI2770: 2018". Further classification systems are commonly used, such as "IEC61355-1: 2008".
Information elements of individual VDI 2770 DocumentVersion entities. Note: at the time of handover, this collection shall include at least one DocumentVersion.
This property contains a list of languages used within the DocumentVersion. Each property codes one language identification according to ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-2 used in the Document.
Design that partly deviates from the previous
Denotes the focus of the document and has a referential or communicative function, which is to refer to the content, subject matter or theme of the document
text note

value.text: PDF document with step-by-step assembly instructions for the turtle figure

description.text: List of language-dependent keywords of the Document. Note: Mutiple keywords are given as comma separated list for each language. Constraint: For each language-depended KeyWord a Title and Summary shall exist for the given language. Note: This can be intentionally a blank.
Date when the document status was set. Format is YYYY-MM-dd.

Each document version represents a point in time in the document life cycle. This status value refers to the milestones in the document life cycle. The following two values should be used for the application of this guideline: InReview (under review), Released (released)
Organiziation short name of the author of the Document.
Official name of the organization of author of the Document.
Note: each DigitalFile represents the same content or Document version, but can be provided in different technical formats (PDF, PDFA, html, etc.) or by a link.

Provides a preview image of the DocumentVersion, e.g. first page, in a commonly used image format and low resolution. Note: low resolution e.g. < 512 x 512 pixels. Constraint: the MIME type needs to match the file type. Allowed file types are JPG, PNG, BMP.
Each SMC describes a Document (see IEC 82045-1 and IEC 8245-2), which is associated to the particular Asset Administration Shell.
Set of document identifiers for the Document. One ID in this collection should be used as a preferred ID
Identification of the domain in which the given DocumentId is unique. The domain ID can e.g., be the name or acronym of the providing organisation.
Identification number of the Document within a given domain, e.g. the providing organisation.
Set of information for describing the classification of the Document according to ClassificationSystems. Constraint: at least one classification according to VDI 2770 shall be provided.
Unique ID of the document class within a classficationsystem. Constraint: If ClassificationSystem is set to “VDI2770:2018”, the given IDs of VDI2770:2018 shall be used

List of language-dependent names of the selected ClassID. Constraint: If ClassificationSystem is set to “VDI2770:2018” then the given names of VDI2770:2018 need be used. Constraint: languages shall match at least the language specifications of the included DocumentVersions (below).
Identification of the classification system. For classifications according VDI 2270 always set to "VDI2770: 2018". Further classification systems are commonly used, such as "IEC61355-1: 2008".
Information elements of individual VDI 2770 DocumentVersion entities. Note: at the time of handover, this collection shall include at least one DocumentVersion.
This property contains a list of languages used within the DocumentVersion. Each property codes one language identification according to ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-2 used in the Document.
Design that partly deviates from the previous
Denotes the focus of the document and has a referential or communicative function, which is to refer to the content, subject matter or theme of the document
text note

value.text: PDF document with general safety information derived from manufacturer's website and documentation

description.text: List of language-dependent keywords of the Document. Note: Mutiple keywords are given as comma separated list for each language. Constraint: For each language-depended KeyWord a Title and Summary shall exist for the given language. Note: This can be intentionally a blank.
Date when the document status was set. Format is YYYY-MM-dd.

Each document version represents a point in time in the document life cycle. This status value refers to the milestones in the document life cycle. The following two values should be used for the application of this guideline: InReview (under review), Released (released)
Organiziation short name of the author of the Document.
Official name of the organization of author of the Document.
Note: each DigitalFile represents the same content or Document version, but can be provided in different technical formats (PDF, PDFA, html, etc.) or by a link.

Provides a preview image of the DocumentVersion, e.g. first page, in a commonly used image format and low resolution. Note: low resolution e.g. < 512 x 512 pixels. Constraint: the MIME type needs to match the file type. Allowed file types are JPG, PNG, BMP.
